business.headline: Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

Housing sales slide 14% as affordability pressures mount across cities: ReportThe PropTiger report, which tracks sales and launches across major cities, found that the most significant annual drop was recorded in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and Pune, where sales fell by 32% and 27% respectively.

Why this IITian took up a guard's job to build Mygate, valued at Rs 1,600 croreMyGate has raised a total of $83.3 million across eight rounds. Its latest funding was in April 2023, a Series B round worth $3.29 million, putting its valuation at Rs 1,670 crore, according to Tracxn.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Are private school fees draining India's middle class? CA shares eye-opening figuresWith fees climbing each year, parents are feeling the pinch more than ever. Maybe now is the right moment to pause, think, and ask ourselves, are we getting real value for this cost? Can we secure our kids' future without spending a fortune on fees? asks a Delhi-based CA.

SSY scheme: How your daughter can get Rs 71 lakh at 21It is a small savings scheme backed by the government, which offers high interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C, and tax-free returns on maturity. Over 4.1 crore accounts have been opened so far under this scheme.

Good news soon for HDFC Bank shareholders? Here's all you need to knowHDFC Bank shares have delivered a 24% gain over the past year, with a year-to-date rise of nearly 13%. The stock has climbed more than 21% over the last six months, posting gains of 7% over the past three months and 4% in the previous month.

Did Ashok Leyland shares fall over 50% today? Details hereThe steep drop is the result of the company's 1:1 bonus issue, which came into effect on Wednesday. When a stock goes "ex-bonus," its price adjusts to reflect the additional shares being issued.
Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.64 points to 82,373.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 61.80 points to 25,134.00 as of 9:28 am.

Anthem Biosciences IPO to close for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMPThis IPO is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. The company itself will not receive any money from this offer. The price band has been set at Rs 570 per share.

Big GST changes ahead? Centre signals green light, says reportThe Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has given an in-principle nod to a revamp of the GST structure, paving the way for possible reforms in the upcoming GST Council meeting scheduled for August.

entertainment.headline: Mitti Ek Nayi Pehchan review: Ishwak Singh's film brings rural India alive onscreenRelease Date:Thu Jul 10, 2025'Mitti: Ek Nayi Pehchan' is an emotional and honest story of a man who returns to his village and reconnects with his roots. Without any drama or glamour, the show shows the real life and struggles of rural India. Read our review.

Chiranjeevi and Telugu directors mourn Ravi Teja's father Rajagopal Raju's deathTelugu actor Ravi Teja's father, Bhupathiraju Rajagopal Raju, died at the age of 90, on Tuesday. Several known personalities from the Telugu film industry, including veteran actor Chiranjeevi, offered their condolences to the 'Dhamaka' actor.

The White Lotus Season 4 in works. Details'The White Lotus' is set for a fourth season with creator Mike White exploring new filming locations, possibly warmer destinations like Mexico or Egypt. Fans can expect the show to return by late 2026 or 2027.

Anupam Kher admits marriage with Kirron Kher isn't the bestAnupam Kher, who has been married to Kirron Kher for 30 years, shared that he believes compatibility in a relationship is often given too much importance. He also revealed that he has, at times, unintentionally hurt H

Sidhu Moosewala's world tour announced 3 years after his death. What it meansSidhu Moosewala's official Instagram announced the groundbreaking 'Signed to God' world tour, set for 2026 - three years after his death. The tour aims to celebrate his legacy in a never-before-seen format.

Exclusive: How an Instagram reel got Shanaya Kapoor her first feature filmDirector Santosh Singh introduced Shanaya Kapoor in his latest romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. In an exclusive interview with us, he revealed that the debutante wasn't the first choice for the role.

KJo, Samantha, Parineeti lead celeb cheers as Sidharth-Kiara welcome baby girlActors Parineeti Chopra and Samantha Ruth Prabhu were amongst several celebrities who wished Bollywood couple Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani. The two announced the birth of their baby girl on Wednesday.

Nine hospitalised after stampede at Beyonce's Atlanta Cowboy Carter showSeveral Beyonce fans were injured in a stampede caused by a shouting passenger on a train following her concert in Atlanta. The incident occurred as the crowd reacted to the disturbance.

Nithya Menen had cow dung in nails while accepting National Award. Here's whyActor Nithya Menen recently opened up about the challenges she faced for her role in Dhanush's 'Idly Kadai'. She revealed that she had cow dung on her nails, which coincided with her accepting the National Film Award.

Ramayana aims to redefine world's perception of India: Producer Namit MalhotraProducer Namit Malhotra discussed his vision for Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. Malhotra said he wanted to centre Indian culture internationally, and decided to change Western perception of India.

Lewis Hamilton shares Jimin's Dior look, fans call it best crossover momentFormula 1 legend Lewis Hamilton shared a photo of BTS' Jimin dressed in an outfit from his Dior collection. The post sent fans into a frenzy online.

Kamal Haasan meets friend Rajinikanth ahead of Rajya Sabha oath taking ceremonyActor-politician Kamal Haasan met his longtime friend and actor Rajinikanth at the latter's Chennai home on Wednesday. The meeting happened days ahead of Haasan's oath-taking ceremony as a Rajya Sabha member.

Manisha Koirala gets honorary doctorate from University of Bradford, shares videoManisha Koirala was awarded an honorary doctorate by the University of Bradford. She also paid an emotional tribute to her late grandmother, whom she called her 'first teacher.'

Selena Gomez to marry Benny Blanco in September ceremony: ReportSinger Selena Gomez and her boyfriend Benny Blanco are reportedly planning a September wedding in Montecito, California. The wedding invitations have been sent out to their close friends and family.

Archana Puran Singh and family fall victim to online scam during Dubai tripArchana Puran Singh shared in her vlog that she and her family were scammed while booking indoor skydiving tickets in Dubai through a fake website. Despite paying a hefty amount, no reservation was found, leaving the family shocked and disappointed.

Actor Ram Pothineni debuts as lyricist with Andhra King TalukaTelugu actor Ram Pothineni is making his debut as a lyricist by penning the first single for his upcoming movie 'Andhra King Taluka'. With music by Anirudh Ravichander, the song will release on July 18, 2025.

Rajinikanth takes morning stroll in Chennai before Coolie release, pic goes viralSuperstar Rajinikanth was seen going on a casual morning walk in Chennai. A photo of the actor is now going viral on social media.

Sidharth-Kiara announce birth of baby girl in sweet post: Our world forever changedKiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra became parents to a baby girl. On Wednesday morning, the couple shared the good news with the world, and expressed just how excited and happy they felt.

Mohit Suri backs Sandeep Reddy Vanga, says we make his films controversialFilmmaker Mohit Suri has come out in support of 'Animal' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga, calling himself a fan and defending his storytelling style. He said the controversies around Vanga's films are often audience-created.

general news.headline: Pahalgam terrorists fired in air to celebrate after killing 26: EyewitnessIn the ongoing investigation into the recent Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 civilians, it has been revealed that terrorists were seen resorting to celebratory firing immediately following the carnage.

Drenched, Mamata Banerjee leads march over 'targeting' of Bengali migrantsThe march, in the heart of Kolkata, was held in protest against the alleged harassment of Bengali-speaking people in BJP-ruled states.

Not a child to understand what favour I need, Odisha professor 'told' studentThe internal complaint committee had advised the professor, accused of sexually harassing the student who died after setting herself on fire, to modify his behaviour and teaching methods.

Learnt from news I hit Fauja Singh: NRI arrested for legendary marathoner's deathDuring police questioning, NRI Amritpal Singh Dhillon revealed that he was returning from Mukerian after selling his phone when his vehicle struck 114-year-old athlete Fauja Singh near Bias Pind.

Why no cameras in cockpits? Air India crash sparks debate, demandThe fuel-switch report in the Air India Boeing 787 crash probe has sparked a demand for a cockpit video recorder. The NTSB of the US that probes air crashes has for years batted for one. If cockpit voice recorders are part of the black boxes of planes, what has kept cockpit video recorders, which would aid air crash investigations, from being installed?

Supreme Court allows Ashoka professor to post online, raps SIT over probe delayThe Supreme Court on Wednesday blasted the team probing the case against Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad in Operation Sindoor post case for delay in preparing the report. The bench also allowed the professor to continue posting online except on sub judice matters.

If you're Prime Minister of India and...: Nato's warning over buying Russian oilMark Rutte warned the leaders of China, India, and Brazil that if they continued trading with Russia and buying its oil and gas, he would impose 100 per cent secondary sanctions.
Kota: How India's coaching capital collapsedThe government is now intent on an education that promotes critical thinking rather than the rote learning coaching institutes foster

Happy World Snake Day, dear relativesSnakes are a misunderstood and feared lot, though 75% of them found in India are non-venomous. On World Snake Day, paying tribute to a species that's more venomous and strikes without provocation, our relatives.

Some Pak drones were found intact during Op Sindoor: Chief of Defence StaffAnil Chauhan, Chief of Defence Staff, said on Wednesday that some of the drones shot by Pakistan towards India during the four-day conflict after Operation Sindoor were found intact, implying that they may have not even functioned.

Samosa, Jalebi and a side of perspective: Not every treat needs a warning labelAs the Health Ministry opts for gentle 'oil and sugar' advisory boards over harsh labels, perhaps the real question isn't whether Indian treats are the problem but what we're conveniently ignoring on our globalised plates

Sunil Chhetri's first reaction over ISL's uncertain future: Very concerningIndian Super League: Sunil Chhetri urged calm and unity across Indian football as uncertainty looms over the ISL's future, expressing faith in the AIFF and FSDL to find a solution that protects the sport's growth and stability.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

My daughter was killed: Father of Odisha student who self-immolated breaks downA 20-year-old Odisha student died after setting herself on fire on campus, accusing her professor of sexual harassment. Her father has called it murder, alleging she was forced to end her life.

After Sena MLA's slapgate, MVA leaders protest against 'chaddi-baniyan' governmentAfter Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad was caught on video thrashing a canteen contractor in a vest and towel, opposition leaders staged a 'chaddi-baniyan' protest inside the Maharashtra Assembly.

Was Air India crash mechanical, accidental or…? FAQs answeredThe preliminary crash probe report has raised critical questions around how fuel supply to the engines got cut off. INDIA TODAY looks at the scenarios

Extracurricular or extra-charge? What schools aren't telling youAre extracurricular activities building skills or just burning holes in parents' pockets? A global comparison reveals the growing cost and consequences of India's ECA boom.

Sidharth-Kiara announce birth of baby girl in sweet post: Our world forever changedKiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra became parents to a baby girl. On Wednesday morning, the couple shared the good news with the world, and expressed just how excited and happy they felt.

Akbar, Babur, Aurangzeb face historical scrutiny in NCERT's class 8 textbookNCERT Class 8 Social Science books will now teach about the atrocities during the Sultanate and Mughal periods, including the destruction of temples and the slaughter of masses. The new textbooks will offer a broader perspective on Maratha history.

Millions dead, Aadhaar still active: RTI finds only 1.15 crore cards deactivatedDespite over 83 lakh deaths recorded annually, UIDAI's cumbersome, certificate-dependent process has led to less than 10% of estimated deaths, resulting in Aadhaar deactivation, raising risks of misuse.

As AI gets smarter, study says humans are starting to sound and talk more like ChatGPTWhen we use technology, it also changes us. Or so says a new study which highlights that as humans use more and more ChatGPT, they have started sounding like an AI tool in their words and language.

Sidhu Moosewala's world tour announced 3 years after his death. What it meansSidhu Moosewala's official Instagram announced the groundbreaking 'Signed to God' world tour, set for 2026 - three years after his death. The tour aims to celebrate his legacy in a never-before-seen format.
How climate extremes burnt and then submerged New YorkThis rare overlap of extreme heat and deluge is part of a broader pattern of volatile weather impacting much of the US this summer.

Several known personalities from the Telugu film industry, including veteran actor Chiranjeevi, offered their condolences to the 'Dhamaka' actor.

KJo, Samantha, Parineeti lead celeb cheers as Sidharth-Kiara welcome baby girlActors Parineeti Chopra and Samantha Ruth Prabhu were amongst several celebrities who wished Bollywood couple Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani. The two announced the birth of their baby girl on Wednesday.

sports.headline: King Charles meets Team India, asks about Akash Deep's sisterThe Indian cricket teams met King Charles during their England tour with heartfelt interactions. Charles asked about Akash Deep's sister, who is currently under treatment for cancer.

Joe Root dethrones Harry Brook to reclaim top spot in ICC Test rankingsEngland star Joe Root reclaimed the No.1 spot in ICC Test batting rankings after his century at Lord's, overtaking teammate Harry Brook and marking his eighth time at the top of the global charts.

ICC AGM: Two-tier Test system, T20 World Cup expansion to be discussedThe ICC's four-day AGM starting on Thursday will focus on key topics like the proposed two-tier Test system, T20 World Cup expansion, and new member ratifications. With the 2025-27 World Test Championship underway, discussions will center on funding and promotion-relegation rules within the two-tier format.

Coach Sanath Jayasuriya dismisses pressure talk following 2nd T20I lossSri Lanka head coach Sanath Jayasuriya insisted on Tuesday that the team is not under pressure despite their embarrassing 83-run loss to Bangladesh in the second T20I.

Broad, Buttler believe chirpy Sundar, Nitish fuelled England's Lord's winEngland vs India: Stuart Broad and Jos Buttler felt Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar's on-field antics on days three and four of the Lord's Test backfired, contributing to India's heartbreaking loss.

Sunil Chhetri's first reaction over ISL's uncertain future: Very concerningIndian Super League: Sunil Chhetri urged calm and unity across Indian football as uncertainty looms over the ISL's future, expressing faith in the AIFF and FSDL to find a solution that protects the sport's growth and stability.

England penalised two WTC points for slow overrate in Lord's Test against IndiaEngland have been docked two ICC World Test Championship points for a slow over rate in the Lord's Test against India. This penalty has pushed England down to third place, affecting their championship hopes.

Japan Open 2025: PV Sindhu crashes out in opening roundPV Sindhu's struggles continued as the two-time Olympic medallist crashed out in the first round of the Japan Open 2025 Super 750 tournament. In contrast, Lakshya Sen and the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty registered commanding straight-game victories to advance to the second round.

Stuart MacGill breaks silence on life after cocaine case: Worried for my kidsFormer Australian spinner Stuart MacGill has opened up about the toll of his legal troubles on his life and family. He reveals how anxiety and isolation have affected him and his children while he tries to rebuild through cricket coaching.

Satwik-Chirag, Lakshya Sen cruise into second round of Japan Open 2025India's campaign at the Japan Open 2025 began on a high note, with Satwik-Chirag and Lakshya Sen cruising into the second round after impressive straight-game wins in their respective men's doubles and singles matches.

Andrew Flintoff drafts son Rocky as wilcard for Northern SuperchargersAndrew Flintoff's 17-year-old son Rocky has joined his dad's team, Northern Superchargers, as a wildcard pick for The Hundred 2025 — just days after scoring a century against India U-19 in a Youth ODI.

England penalised two WTC points for slow overrate in Lord's Test against IndiaEngland have been docked two ICC World Test Championship points for a slow over rate in the Lord's Test against India. This penalty has pushed England down to third place, affecting their championship hopes.

Japan Open 2025: PV Sindhu crashes out in opening roundPV Sindhu's struggles continued as the two-time Olympic medallist crashed out in the first round of the Japan Open 2025 Super 750 tournament. In contrast, Lakshya Sen and the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty registered commanding straight-game victories to advance to the second round.

Stuart MacGill breaks silence on life after cocaine case: Worried for my kidsFormer Australian spinner Stuart MacGill has opened up about the toll of his legal troubles on his life and family. He reveals how anxiety and isolation have affected him and his children while he tries to rebuild through cricket coaching.

Satwik-Chirag, Lakshya Sen cruise into second round of Japan Open 2025India's campaign at the Japan Open 2025 began on a high note, with Satwik-Chirag and Lakshya Sen cruising into the second round after impressive straight-game wins in their respective men's doubles and singles matches.

Andrew Flintoff drafts son Rocky as wilcard for Northern SuperchargersAndrew Flintoff's 17-year-old son Rocky has joined his dad's team, Northern Superchargers, as a wildcard pick for The Hundred 2025 — just days after scoring a century against India U-19 in a Youth ODI.

Crawley has learned nothing in 57 Tests: Boycott wants England to drop openerFormer England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott has called for Zak Crawley to be dropped after a series of disappointing performances. After a steady 65 in the first Test at Headingley, Crawley has struggled to maintain form, managing only 19, 0, 18, and 22 in his subsequent innings.

India could have been 3-0 up with a bit of luck in England series: Ravi ShastriFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri believes that, with a touch more luck, India might have taken a commanding 3-0 lead in the ongoing five-match Test series against England.

Karun Nair's dismissal was turning point in Lord's Test: Ajinkya RahaneAjinkya Rahane called Karun Nair's second-innings dismissal the turning point in the Lord's Test, as India's chase lost momentum following his LBW, opening the door for England to claw back into the match.

Atletico Madrid agree deal to sign Argentina's Thiago Almada from BotafogoAtletico Madrid have confirmed an agreement to sign Argentina midfielder Thiago Almada from Brazilian club Botafogo, pending the player's medical examination and contract signing.

Kohli, Rohit retired on own will, BCCI has no role: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has set the record straight on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirements, stating that the BCCI had no influence, and that both legends made the decision entirely on their own terms.

British tennis player Tara Moore handed four-year doping banBritish tennis player Tara Moore has been banned for four years after sport's highest court overturned her earlier exoneration in a doping case. The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) on Tuesday upheld an appeal by the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA), reversing a previous ruling that had cleared the 32-year-old.

India vs England Women's ODI Series 2025, Live streaming: All you need to knowFresh off a 3-2 victory in the T20I series, India Women are set to take on England Women once again in a three-match ODI series, starting Wednesday, July 16. The opening ODI will be a day-night encounter at The Rose Bowl in Southampton.

India Women seek balance amid key issues before World CupIND-W vs ENG-W: India Women will have the advantage of playing the ODI World Cup in front of their home crowd, but they need to finetune certain aspects of their lineup in their upcoming ODI series against England and Australia.

Kohli, Rohit retired on own will, BCCI has no role: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has set the record straight on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirements, stating that the BCCI had no influence, and that both legends made the decision entirely on their own terms.

British tennis player Tara Moore handed four-year doping banBritish tennis player Tara Moore has been banned for four years after sport's highest court overturned her earlier exoneration in a doping case. The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) on Tuesday upheld an appeal by the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA), reversing a previous ruling that had cleared the 32-year-old.

India vs England Women's ODI Series 2025, Live streaming: All you need to knowFresh off a 3-2 victory in the T20I series, India Women are set to take on England Women once again in a three-match ODI series, starting Wednesday, July 16. The opening ODI will be a day-night encounter at The Rose Bowl in Southampton.

India Women seek balance amid key issues before World CupIND-W vs ENG-W: India Women will have the advantage of playing the ODI World Cup in front of their home crowd, but they need to finetune certain aspects of their lineup in their upcoming ODI series against England and Australia.

The ball that bowled Siraj in Lord's Test: A freak delivery and pure bad luckEngland vs India: In a surreal final twist at Lord's, Mohammed Siraj was bowled by a delivery from Shoaib Bashir that spun off the pitch, the bat, and then the pitch again - a freak dismissal that defied cricketing logic. Siraj's gritty 30-ball stay ended when he was bowled as England went on to win a thriller by 22 runs.

Why Stokes and Bumrah's workload management is incomparableENG vs IND: Ben Stokes and Jasprit Bumrah recently came to the limelight for their workload management after England won the Lord's Test by 22 runs to go 2-1 up in the five-match series.

She has been outstanding: Harmanpreet impressed with 20-year-old DC spinnerENG-W vs IND-W: Harmanpreet Kaur heaped praise on left-arm spinner Shree Charani, who took 10 wickets in the T20Is on English soil and won the Player of the Series award.

De Bruyne to inherit Maradona's No.10? Napoli training photos suggest yesNapoli could unretire Diego Maradona's No.10 kit to give to Kevin de Bruyne. The Belgian was seen wearing a No.10 training kit ahead of their pre-season games.

India should have chased 193: Ganguly disappointed after Lord's Test defeatENG vs IND: Former captain Sourav Ganguly was disappointed after India lost the Lord's Test by 22 runs, failing to chase down 193. Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 61 wasn't enough for India to taste victory on Monday.

Archer eyes Ashes 2025 tour: Will do everything to be on the plane in NovemberJofra Archer has made his intentions clear. He aims to be fit and cleared to compete without any hassles for the upcoming Ashes tour, later this year.

Court stays arrest of cricketer Yash Dayal in alleged sexual exploitation caseAn FIR was registered on July 6 at the Indirapuram police station in Ghaziabad district under Section 69 of the BNS. Yash Dayal has been accused of sexually exploiting a woman on the pretext of marriage.

Watch: Bumrah, Pant and Gill chat with Idris Elba at King Charles' homeDuring the meeting with King Charles at his London home, some of the Indian cricketers got the chance to meet popular English actor, Idris Elba. The group were seen having a chat talking about the sport.

Bumrah gets new workload management advice: Play last 2 Tests in England, rest laterEngland vs India: Jasprit Bumrah was initially scheduled to play only three of the five Tests in the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy. However, with India trailing 1–2 after the Lord's thriller, former captain Anil Kumble has suggested that the pace spearhead should play the final two matches.

Aggression not for everyone: Gill needs his own voice, not mimic KohliENG vs IND: Is Shubman Gill unintentionally trying to do what Virat Kohli does? Since his appointment as Test skipper, some of his actions have been eerily similar to the former captain, and this could be a possible concern in the long run.

27 all-out triggers panic: West Indies board calls legends for crisis talksCricket West Indies (CWI) have hit the panic button as they have called for an emergency review meeting after the nightmare pink-ball Test in Jamaica where Australia ran riot to end the game in just two and a half days.

Watch: Indian cricket teams meet King Charles III in London day after Lord's TestKing Charles II met the Indian men's and women's teams at St James's Palace in London on Tuesday. The men's team lost the Lord's Test by 22 runs, while the women's team will take part in a three-match ODI series following their 3-2 triumph in the ODI series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
